issue.title: gpu_ray not supported with NVIDIA 1050 installed

content.raw:
Let me revise my question.

If you've installed drivers for the card and they work, ROS and Gazebo 7, and all the software in the directions, is there anything else needed for gpu_ray to work?
content.html:
Let me revise my question.

If you've installed drivers for the card and they work, ROS and Gazebo 7, and all the software in the directions, is there anything else needed for gpu_ray to work?

issue.title: gpu_ray not supported with NVIDIA 1050 installed

content.raw: Make sure you're using the proprietary nVidia binary drivers instead of the Nouveau ones.  I'm using version 367.57 on a GTX1060 and have not had any issues.
content.html: Make sure you're using the proprietary nVidia binary drivers instead of the Nouveau ones. I'm using version 367.57 on a GTX1060 and have not had any issues.

issue.title: gpu_ray not supported with NVIDIA 1050 installed

content.raw:
I'm running the nVidia 370.20 driver which is the one for this card. So apparently nothing else is needed except a driver that Gazebo recognizes as suitable?

You don't get the gpu_ray warning message?
content.html:
I'm running the nVidia 370.20 driver which is the one for this card. So apparently nothing else is needed except a driver that Gazebo recognizes as suitable?

You don't get the gpu_ray warning message?

issue.title: gpu_ray not supported with NVIDIA 1050 installed

content.raw:
I get the following warnings, but the lidar scans that I get are fine.  I don't have any other warnings referencing gpu_ray.

~~~~
[Wrn] [msgs.cc:1793] Conversion of sensor type[imu] not suppported.
[Wrn] [msgs.cc:1793] Conversion of sensor type[imu] not suppported.
[Wrn] [msgs.cc:1793] Conversion of sensor type[imu] not suppported.

[Wrn] [msgs.cc:1793] Conversion of sensor type[multicamera] not suppported.
[Wrn] [msgs.cc:1793] Conversion of sensor type[gpu_ray] not suppported.
[Wrn] [msgs.cc:1793] Conversion of sensor type[force_torque] not suppported.
[Wrn] [msgs.cc:1793] Conversion of sensor type[force_torque] not suppported.
~~~~

issue.title: gpu_ray not supported with NVIDIA 1050 installed

content.raw: Apologies for those console warnings from `msgs.cc`; they come from gzclient trying to parse info about each model for display purposes, but it doesn't know how to parse info about those sensors yet. It doesn't affect the functioning of the sensors, just introspection from gzclient.
content.html: Apologies for those console warnings from msgs.cc; they come from gzclient trying to parse info about each model for display purposes, but it doesn't know how to parse info about those sensors yet. It doesn't affect the functioning of the sensors, just introspection from gzclient.

issue.title: gpu_ray not supported with NVIDIA 1050 installed

content.raw: Since these aren't real problem messages I'll close it.
content.html: Since these aren't real problem messages I'll close it.
